result.execSummary:
The defendant Christerfer R. Kirby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christerfer R. Kirby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:55 PM: Defendant Christerfer R. Kirby in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA states that matter is resolved and Def would like to bring to conclusion today if possible.  Court articulates agreement reached and Def confirms same.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 DC:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Statement by Defendant:  None offered.  The Court:  45 days I/S - S/W (GT and Huber if revoked) - 1 yr probation.  Early termination thru agent after completion of 6 mos. Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court Costs plus DNA sample and surcharge - Def to report today to WCJ to provide sample.    Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Recalled @ 3:21 PM: Defendant Christerfer R. Kirby in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of appearance, warrant prevously authorized has been withdrawn.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves a copy of the Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to speak with the State on his own without counsel.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:55 pm.

Case Called @ 2:07 PM: Defendant Christerfer R. Kirby not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.
